body: Shouldn't it be `'none' : '';`?
Isn't the display mode by default fixed?
![screenshot from 2014-06-20 02 34 16](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/97088/3335360/a7699dfc-f812-11e3-866d-a437383446f2.png)
I guess you should add a space after `:`
I guess I should, my bad :)
Seems my build toolchain put more indent in here, i'll look into making this diff less bad.
In the meantime, GH can ignore whitespace in the diff: https://github.com/dataarts/dat.gui/pull/184/files?w=1

This is quite odd, as its not consistently doing 4 spaces, the rest of the file is 2. I tried explicitly specifying 2 spaces and it didn't fix it. Actually made the diff worse. I think it's not worth trying to figure out what rollup / babel madness is causing this as it's generated code. Are you ok with this indentation inconsistency here?
See https://rollupjs.org/guide/en#output-exports-exports for docs on this option. Without it, rollup warns we're mixing named and default exports, and this option basically says "yeah that's fine".

diff_hunk:
@@ -44,7 +44,7 @@
     "rollup-plugin-node-resolve": "^3.0.2",
     "rollup-plugin-sass": "^0.5.3",
     "rollup-plugin-uglify": "^2.0.1",
-    "serve": "^6.4.8"
+    "serve": "^6.4.8 <6.5.4"
body: dat.gui's build system is not currently compatible with node 8 or above due to the version of node-sass used by rollup so I built it with node 7. However "serve" lost compatibility with node 7 in 6.5.4 so clamped it back down.
If I'm reading right, shouldn't both `import dat` and `import * as dat` work now?

body: Interesting... that's `rollup-plugin-sass` I suppose with the old version I suppose?
Let's just remove the `build/*` files from the PR, can compile them at next release.
Oh, I see you said this above. Sounds good to recommend the tree-shaking-friendly syntax.

body: Yeah, although I'm sure there are newer versions that are compatible for building with node 8 it's just a matter of doing the necessary upgrades to package json and / or the lockfile and then verifying.

body: It's fine if you'd like to add this in the Changelog, but I'm not sure these changes make sense to merge in the official repo right?
I'm not sure about having a per-controller show/hide feature... Do you mind putting this part in a separate PR?

I will close this one and open another with just the suggested edits in a new PR.
